problem:
# Static Discipline VLOW = 0.0 VOL = 1.0 VIL = 2.0 VIH = 3.0 VOH = 4.0 VS = 5.0
RLk = 1 RL = 1e3*RLk RON = 10
CGSp = 0.1 CGS = 1e-12*CGSp
RTH = RON*RL/(RON+RL) VTH = RON*VS/(RON+RL)
tau = RTH*CGS
tf = -tau*math.log((VOL-VTH)/(VS-VTH))
tfp = tf*1e12
Given that \(R_{ON} = $RON\Omega\), \(R_L = $RLk\)k\(\Omega\), and \(C_{GS}=$CGSp\)pF.
What is the time, in picoseconds, that it takes for the signal at node B to fall to the value of \(V_{OL} = $VOL\)V
